content.rendered:
What are Librarians?

Librarians are responsible for organizing and distributing library materials such as books or film.

Where do Librarians work?

  • Public libraries
  • Universities and schools
  • Museums

How much do Librarians make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Librarians is $46,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Librarians?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Library science majors
  • English majors
  • Philosophy majors
Search Librarian jobs on Handshake

Librarian skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Librarians succeed in their work:

  • High levels of organization
  • Great communication skills
  • Ability to multitask

What are some common questions about Librarians?

Q: What degree do I need to become a Librarian?

A: At least a master’s degree in library science.
